section.name: Why Export?
section.p: For experienced developers this is trivial, but let's explain this for beginners and anyone else interested.

A single developer could work with the same repository all through development and all his customized content will be kept in this repository. In almost all other cases the customized content has to be exported and included in the sources. E.g. when developers work together they will have to share customized content via svn. Furthermore, when a project is be packaged, e.g. to go in production or for a demo, the customized content has to be in the sources.

If you copy a project to another machine, you could also copy the repository. This is especially convenient if it is a derby repository, i.e. on your filesystem. But if you want to use another database to keep your repository, it is especially convenient to use a database independent format like XML as intermediate. Although XML takes a lot of disk space because it has a lot of overhead, in compressed form it is quite small, because the large redundancy in the overhead makes it very compressible.
